SEARCH
Package ru.ifmo.se.commands

Class AddIfMaxCommand

java.lang.Object
ru.ifmo.se.commands.Command
ru.ifmo.se.commands.AddIfMaxCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
Executable
public class AddIfMaxCommand extends Command
Command that adds a new element to the collection only if it's the maximum element. The maximum element is determined using the specified comparator. This command requires exactly one argument (the command name itself).

  • Constructor Summary

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public boolean execute(IOManager ioManager, String[] arguments) throws IOException, WrongAmountOfArguments, WrongInputException
      Executes the add_if_max command, adding a new element to the collection only if it's the maximum element according to the specified comparator.
      Specified by:
      execute in interface Executable
      Specified by:
      execute in class Command
      Parameters:
      ioManager - the IO manager to use for input/output
      arguments - command arguments (should contain only the command name)
      Returns:
      true if the element was added, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      WrongAmountOfArguments - if the number of arguments is not exactly 1
      WrongInputException - if the input for the new element is invalid
